evidence.pdf_reference: The photocatalytic reduction of CO2 with H2O to fuels and chemicals using solar energy is one of the most attractive but highly difficult routes.Thus far, only a very limited number of photocatalysts has been reported to be capable of catalyzing the photocatalytic reduction of CO2 under visible light.The utilization of the localized surface plasmon resonance (LSPR) phenomenon is an attractive strategy for developing visible-light photocatalysts.Herein, we have succeeded in synthesizing plasmonic

activity-determining factor in our system.Further studies were performed with the MoO3-x-TiO2-NT catalyst.When the reaction was carried out under N2 atmosphere instead of CO2 atmosphere, almost no CH4 and only trace CO were detected under N2 atmosphere, confirming that CO and CH4 were formed from CO2 (Fig. 6).The control experiments with heating condition also confirmed that CO and CH4 were formed from photocatalytic reduction of CO2 (Fig. S2).Furthermore, the present MoO3-x-TiO2-NT nanocomposite was

plays a key role in determining the catalytic activity.TiO2-NP, TiO2-NT and MoO3 were inactive under visible light irradiation.MoO3-x and MoO3-x-TiO2 nanocomposites showed very high selectivity for photocatalytic reduction of CO2 and suppressed the production of H2.MoO3-x-TiO2-NT produced a significantly larger amount of (CO CH4) than MoO3-x.The correlation of the LSPR absorption with the catalytic activity (Table 1) suggests that the visible-light absorption ability is the activity-determining factor in

the reactor.The reactor design was reported in our previous paper 13.The light source was a 300 W Xe lamp with a UV cut-off filter ( 420-780 nm).The light intensity was 500 mW cm -2 .The photocatalytic reaction was performed in a gas-solid heterogeneous reaction mode.The powdery photocatalyst (10 mg) was placed on a glass catalyst holder in the upper region of the reactor.Distilled water with a volume of 4.0 cm 3 was pre-charged in the bottom of the reactor.The pressure of CO2 was typically regulated at

ESR spectrometer operated at X-band frequency.The parameters for ESR measurements were as follows: microwave frequency 9.8 GZ, microwave power 20 mW, modulation frequency 100 kHz, attenuator 10 dB.The XPS measurements were performed on a Quantum 2000 Scanning ESCA Microprobe (Physical Electronics) using Al K radiation (1846.6 eV) as the X-ray source. consistent with the observation from ESR.By calculating the ratio of 3d32 peak area of Mo 5 to that of Mo 6 , the percentage of Mo 5 in Mo of MoO3-x was found to be 7.4.Only Mo 6 existed in the MoO3.The percentage of Mo 5 in Mo of MoO3-x-TiO2-NP and MoO3-x-TiO2-NT nanocomposites were 10 and 25, respectively.Higher Mo 5 concentration means higher free carrier concentration in MoO3-x, which can benefit to LSPR effect and increase visible light harvesting.
